comments:
Steps to duplicate:
1. In the Resource view create a dummy file (i.e. dummy.txt)
2. Open up another file then choose File > Save As
3. Try to save over the top of dummy.txt
4. You will be asked "The file already exists...Do you want to replace the 
existing file?" Click on "Yes"
Problem: dummy.txt does not get saved over (in fact it appears as though 
nothing happens)
Tell me if you have any questions or have trouble duplicating this one.

Reproduced with i20050201

The operation fails with the exception below, which is eventually ignored. It
seems a scheduling rule is obtaing for saving the file, and then later, in a
nested operation, a rule corresponding to the parent is used, which is illegal.

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Attempted to beginRule: P/A, does not match
outer scope rule: L/A/Copy of read.me

Sorry, I meant: "a scheduling rule is *obtained*"

This has been in since 3.0.

Fixed in HEAD.
Available in builds > I20050214-0800

Verified I20050217-2000
Filed bug 85802 for inappropriate warning

traces.message: Attempted to beginRule: P/A, does not match outer scope rule: L/A/Copy of read.me
